title.rendered: Gold medals are not actually gold

content.rendered:
Not all that glitters is gold. Although the name by which the medals most coveted by athletes are called is that. Neither in these Olympic Games in Rio de Janeiro nor in any previous one do gold medals exist. Those who finish second receive silver medals and so do the champions, although theirs are covered with a small layer of gold.

That figure was a surprise even for those in charge of manufacturing the approximately 5,000 medals for the Rio Games.

“Our operators and some of our developers had the same question,” Victor Hugo Berbert, who oversaw the manufacturing process for the medals, told the AP. “We can make pure gold medals, but we know how expensive they would be. So gold medals…are not exactly pure gold.”

Gold medals are the highest award at the Olympic Games. Even if it is a wrong name. (AP)

As reported by the Olympic Committee, the medals that will be awarded to the champions in these Games weigh half a kilo, so it is estimated that if they wanted to make them of pure gold it would cost about $23,500 in raw material. When made of silver with a small layer of Brazilian gold, the value of the metal is around 600 dollars.

Gold medals are the highest award at the Olympic Games. Even if it is a wrong name. (AP)

The process of making the medals is usually the task of the national mint. This happened this year, and Berbert indicated that the process took about two years, from design to IOC approval.

“We had to develop the whole concept of the medal. We worked a lot on the art, the design, on the materials. We tried to translate their idea into an Olympic medal, and we used our experience in medal production to turn it into what they wanted” , he added.

Gold is certified for a certain purity and is considered to be of very high quality. Silver and bronze are made mostly from recycled materials.
